value.title: Google admits its diabetic blindness AI fell short in real-life tests
value.excerpt: The AI Google trained to catch diabetic blindness exhibited 90 percent accuracy in the lab, but it unfortunately didn’t perform as well in real life. In Thailand, it could take up to 10 weeks to confirm diabetic blindness from the time a medical practitioner takes photos of the patient’s eye.

images.title: Google admits its diabetic blindness AI fell short in real-life tests
